subject: Standard Operating Procedure for Go-Live of Public Toll Plazas- reg.
text: HRay 75 rTHrf ufera5rot (7e35 4Rdev 3 rTHrf HArT4, 4RG TRaFT) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) 474 Ta 01-5 Qdi 6, 7az7-10, ERGF, # fovlt 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 TA/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Management of Plazas /2023 Policy Circular No. 17.5.85/ 2023 dated 31st July, 2023 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. IHMCL/SOP /Toll (Comp. No. 213769)} Sub: Standard Operating Procedure for Go-Live of Public Toll Plazas. Early Go-Live of User fee Plaza after the PCOD/COD of NH Project is of paramount importance as it is the first step towards monetization of the Project stretch: The start of fee Plaza is a multi-facet task involving various activities and coordination between multiple agencies. To bring uniformity and efficiency in the process, a Standard Operating Procedure as under has been prepared which will facilitate the PIUs for smooth on boarding and Go-Live of new fee Plazas. SI Nol Activity Action By During Construction Stage- Six months prior to anticipated Completion of the Project The Draft Toll Fee Notification should be prepared and initiated on PD RO CO e-Office using draft template. clarifications regarding issues like Division different span of LHS/RHS bridge, 2/4 Lane intermediate stretch etc should be promptly discussed with CO Division during preparation of Draft Toll Fee Notification. In any case the Draft Toll Fee Notification should be initiated before six months of anticipated completion of the Highway Project in terms with Ministry' s Guidelines No NH- 15017/5/2019-P&M dated 07.03.2019. 2 Construction of Highway facilities like Side Amenities (Rest PD Contractor Areas, Truck Lay byes, Toilet Blocks etc) especially in greenfield Concessionaire Highways, may also be expedited so that they are also completed AEI IE NHLML (if before the anticipated COD/PCOD to give full Customer Satisfaction WSA undertaken to the Road Users who will be paying Toll Fee while using the by them) completed Highway. During Construction Stage- Three months prior to anticipated Completion of the Project 3 Annual Potential Collection (APC) of the fee Plaza should be PD calculated after conducting traffic survey of traffic passing through fee Plaza location. The traffic survey can be conducted through the Contractor Concessionaire/ AEIIE or through IHMCL (through concerned Technical Division) . The APC should be sent to CO Division for bidding and finalization of PD/ RO/ CO Toll Collecting Agency. The User Fee Rates should be approved by RO Division as per Delegation of Power vide NHAI Policy Circular No 17.6.9 dated 13.03.2018* Contd_2I - M U U 9 NHAI Any Way
